head.supplied: 7th June 1858 ¶ ¶ The Committee of the Zoological Society having expressed a desire to have an interview with the Chief Secry for the purpose of presenting a Report of the present state of the Instit...

div.p: F, no. 1241, unit 3, p. 56, VPRS 1187 outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record office, Victoria.
The same letter was also sent to F. McCoy and to F. Selwyn (Nos 1242-3, unit 3, VPRS 1187, Public Record Office, Victoria). 7th June 1858

The Committee of the Zoological Society having expressed a desire to have an interview with the Chief Secry for the purpose of presenting a Report of the present state of the Institution and arranging matters connected with the Society. Mr O'Shanassy has appointed Thursday next at 12 o clock for the interview and I have the honor by desire to write you to be present on the part of the Government

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Dr Mueller Director of Botanic Gardens
See also M to J. Moore, 8 June 1858.
